com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware

Class I2cDeviceImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.I2cControllerPortDeviceImpl
      • com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.I2cDeviceImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HardwareDevice, I2cController.I2cPortReadyCallback, I2cControllerPortDevice, I2cDevice

    public class I2cDeviceImpl
extends I2cControllerPortDeviceImpl
implements I2cDevice, HardwareDevice, I2cController.I2cPortReadyCallback
    Control a single I2C Device

      • getI2cReadCacheLock

        public java.util.concurrent.locks.Lock getI2cReadCacheLock()
        Get access to the read cache lock.

        This is needed if you are accessing the read cache directly. The read cache lock needs to be acquired before attempting to interact with the read cache

        Specified by:
        getI2cReadCacheLock in interface I2cDevice
        Returns:
        the read cache lock

      • getI2cWriteCacheLock

        public java.util.concurrent.locks.Lock getI2cWriteCacheLock()
        Get access to the write cache lock.

        This is needed if you ace accessing the write cache directly. The write cache lock needs to be acquired before attempting to interact with the write cache

        Specified by:
        getI2cWriteCacheLock in interface I2cDevice
        Returns:
        write cache lock

      • getCallbackCount

        public int getCallbackCount()
        Description copied from interface: I2cDevice
        Returns the number of callbacks ever experienced by this I2cDevice instance, whether or not they were ever seen by a registered callback. This method is mostly useful for debugging and gathering of statistics.
        Specified by:
        getCallbackCount in interface I2cDevice
        Returns:
        the number of port-is-ready callbacks ever experienced by this I2cDevice instance
